remarks: A "local" form of ~ gchac .  If ` A ` and ` ~P A ` are GCH-sets, then ` ~P A ` is well-orderable.  The proof is due to Specker.  Theorem 2.1 of [KanamoriPincus] p. 419.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 15-May-2015.)
statement: gchacg $p |- ( ( _om ~<_ A /\ A e. GCH /\ ~P A e. GCH ) -> ~P A e. dom card ) $.
